moroccan.text: Little and lasting is better than much and passing.
Work and you will be strong; sit and you will stink.
You can't catch two frogs with one hand.
A little nod is enough for the wise man; an ass needs a fist.
A narrow space looks wide to the narrow minded.
A pipe of kif in the morning gives one more strength than a camels in the courtyard.
A stone from the hand of a friend is an apple.
A teacher will appear when the student is ready.
A wise man without a book is like a workman with no tools.
A wise woman has much to say and yet remains silent.
Abundance of money is a trial for a man.
All tests are self-adminstered.
Allah gives dried beans to eat to him who has no teeth left.
Among walnuts only the empty one speaks.
An agreement is a kind of debt.
An honest answer is like a kiss on the lips.
An old cat will never learn to dance.
An old cat will not learn how to dance.
Angels bend down their wings to a seeker of knowledge.
As the sands of the desert are to the weary traveler, so are words to he who loveth silence.
Believe what you see and lay aside what you hear.
Better a handful of dried figs and content with that, than to own the gate of peacocks and be kicked in the eye by a broody camel.
Better a patient man than a warrior, one who controls his temper than one who takes a city.
Do not judge a man by the whiteness of his turbin, soap is bought on credit.
Do not respond to a barking dog.
Do not shoot a glass arrow into a painted deer.
Don't cross the bridge till you come to it.
Either do as your neighbors do, or move away.
Endurance pierces marble.
Even as a solid rock is unshaken by the wind, so are the wise unshaken by praise or blame.
Even the loftiest of mountains begins on the ground.
Evening promises are like butter: morning comes, and it's all melted.
Every beetle is a gazelle in the eyes of its mother.
Time wounds all heels.
To the dog who has money, men say: my lord dog.
What is here is elsewhere, what is not here is no where.
What is past is gone, what is hoped for is absent, for you is the hour in which you are.
What use to cover a mend in the Mona Lisa with a crayon.
When a dog cannot bite, it has a bone in its mouth.
When my child and I have eaten -- then clear the table.
Whoever does not respect you, insults you.
With much knowledge there is much sorrow, with much wisdom there is much weeping.
Without fingers, the hand would be a spoon.
One who does not travel will not know that value of men.
One who is not moved by words is not moved by the stick.
One who prevades the great universe is seen by none unless a man knows the unfolding of love.
Open your door to a good day and prepare yourself for a bad one.
Over truth there is light.
Perform good deeds; you will not regret them.
Plans fail for lack of counsel but with many advisors, succeed.
Pleasant words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul and healing to the bone.
Reading books removes sorrows from the heart.
Salt will never be worm-eaten.
Man alone is the measure of all things.
Manage with bread and salted butter until God brings something to eat with it.
Many are the roads that do not lead to the heart.
Many hands make light work.
Meat and mass never hindered man.
No land without stones, no meat without bones.
Nothing dries sooner than a tear.
Nothing is true, all is permisable.
Often the best way to give oneself what one lacks is to take from oneself what one has.
One man's shit is anothers factory of bliss.
The camel never sees his own hump, but that of his brother is always in his eyes.
The dawn does not come twice to awaken a man.
The dreaming man makes excuses for his inaction and places a fools cap on his head.
The driver of an ass must by necessity know its wind.
The enemy of my enemy is my friend.
The falcon does not struggle when he is caught.
The first thing one should own is a home; and it is the last thing one should sell; for a home is ones tomb this side of heaven.
The hand you cannot bite, kiss.
The heart of a fool is in his mouth, the mouth of a wise man is in his heart.
The hen lays an egg, and the cock feels the pain in his backside.
If the prayers of dogs were answered, bones would rain from the sky.
If there were no cold Friday evenings and boring Saturdays, no one would get married any more.
If you are a peg, endure the knocking; if you are a mallet, strike.
If you are afraid of something, you give it power over you.
If you don't understand it with a wink, you certainly will with a blow.
If you find the residents of a place worshipping a donkey, bring the beast some grass.
If you forget your worries, the storm will blow over.
If you know his father and grandfather you may trust his son.
If you see a man riding a wooden stick, say to him "Good health to your horse".
If you see him riding on a bamboo-cane, say to him, "Good health to your horse!"
He who eats when he is full digs his grave with his teeth.
He who enters Fez with a rug, leaves with a money bag.
He who flatters with laughter wants to see you cry.
He who follows the crow will be led the the corpses of dogs.
He who gives fair words feeds you with an empty spoon.
He who has nothing to die for has nothing to live for.
He who has patience with his enemy, rewards himself.
He who is a mocker dances without a tamborine.
He who lacks knowledge derides his neighbor, but the man of understanding holds his tongue.
He who mocks the poor shows contempt for their maker.
A book is like a garden in the pocket.
A crucible for silver and a furnace for gold, but Allah tests the heart.
A devil takes one and makes two, a saint takes two and makes one.
A dog on the run is safely kicked.
A fly will not get into a closed mouth.
A fool's lips bring him strife and invite a beating.
A garden without a fence is like a dog without a tail.
A good name is more valuable than a velvet garment.
A handful of couscous is better than Mecca and all its dust.
A known mistake is better than an unknown truth.
Every dog thinks of his own fleas as gazelles.
Every rose has a thorn as its friend.
Exert effort, you shall be rewarded.
Few desires, happy life.
For he who builds his casbah out of halava; beware the nibblers.
For the sake of a single rose, the gardener becomes servant to a thousand thorns.
Friendship is honey - but don't eat it all.
Friendship is honey -- but don't eat it all.
Friendship is honey, but don't eat it all.
He is a good storyteller who can turn a man's ears into eyes.
Better the gurgling of a camel than the prayers of a fish.
By all means make friends with the dog, but do not lay aside the stick.
By all means trust in Allah, but tie your camel first.
By bread and salt we are united.
Catch the halter rope and it will lead you to the donkey.
Cold teaches a man how to steal charcoal.
Compete, don't envy.
Courage is illusion, balance is the best we can get.
Discipline awaits he who leaves his path.
Do not correct with a strike that which can be taught with a kiss.
He who touches honey is compelled to lick his fingers.
If a man leaves little children behind him, it is as if he did not die.
If a man once fall, all will tread on him.
If a man puts a cord around his neck, God will provide someone to pull it.
If a man told you that a dog had run off with your ear, would you go after the dog or search first for your ear?
If a rich man steals it is a mistake; if a poor man makes a mistake he has stolen.
If at noon the King declares it is night, behold the stars.
If I listen, I have the advantage; if I speak, others have it.
If one tells you the harira is cold, tell him to put his hand in it.
If the judge is against you, you should withdraw the complaint.
The tongue has no bone yet it crushes.
The village gate can be closed, the mouth of the fool, never.
The weight of the burden is known only by he who caries it.
The wind of heaven is that which blows between the horses ears.
The world has not promised anything to anybody.
The world of humans is divided by lines, but the mind knows no limits, the heart no barriers.
There is no beauty but the beauty of action.
There is no queue at the gate of Patience.
Though each path is different, there is only one way.
Three things cause sorrow to flee; water, green trees, and a beautiful face.
If you're going to tell the truth, you better have one foot in the stirrup.
In an instant illumination can be achieved, it is as easy as turning on a light, the problem is finding the switch in the dark.
In every false step there is something good.
In his heart a man may plan his course but God determines his every step.
In Morocco never be surprised. If you see a donkey flying, just say Allah is capable of anything.
In movement, there is blessing.
In the eyes of its mother every beetle is a gazelle.
Instruct a man, you instruct an individual. Instruct a woman, you instruct a nation.
Instruction in youth is like engraving in stone.
It is better to be the object of jealousy, than of pity.
Slowness comes from God and haste from the Devil.
Some will learn through pain and sorrow, others through joy and laughter, so it is written.
Speech and action make the perfect conduct.
Strike a match above the sea of opinions and the fish all swim away.
Strong attachment is difficult -- it makes one mad or kills.
Teaching in youth is like carving in stone.
That which you put into your soup kettle, comes latter onto your spoon.
The barking of dogs does not hurt the clouds.
The best fighting is often against yourself.
The camel driver has his plans and the camel has his.
The jewel is in the lotus.
The mind is free and the slightest thought has great influence. It is therefore important that you think enlightened thoughts.
The moon and the stars are not above us, the earth is on the other side of our feet.
The palm of ones hand does not eclipse the sun.
The pumpkin gives birth and the fence has the trouble.
The quarrel of lovers is the renewal of love.
The same destiny awaits both the wise man and the fool.
The sight of books removes sorrow from the heart.
The sun cannot be covered by a net.
The tar of my country is better than the honey of others.
It is worse to be wounded by words than a sword.
It's the eye that eats.
Kif is like fire; a little warms, a great deal burns.
Kill two birds with the one stone.
Kindness can pluck the whiskers of a lion.
Let us sit bent, but talk straight.
Like a gold ring in a pigs snout is a woman without descretion.
One bean does not make a whole meal.
Little and lasting is better than much and passing.
Little by little, the camel goes into the couscous.
Love truth even if it harms you, and hate lies even if they serve you.
If a man leaves little children behind him, it is as if he did not die
The camel never sees his own hump, but that of his brother is always in his eyes
There is no beauty but the beauty of action.
When a thing becomes perfect, it soon fades.
Instruction in youth is like engraving in stone.
There is no beauty but the beauty of action.
Three things cause sorrow to flee; water, green trees, and a beautiful face.
The radiant and well-understood speech of one person is better than the speech of a thousand people that is not.
The quarrel of lovers is the renewal of love.
Instruction in youth is like engraving in stone.
Three things cause sorrow to flee; water, green trees, and a beautiful face.
There is no beauty but the beauty of action.
Instruction in youth is like engraving in stone.
Instruction in youth is like engraving in stone.
If a rich man steals it is a mistake; if a poor man makes a mistake he has stolen.
Cold teaches a man how to steal charcoal.
Reading books removes sorrows from the heart.
It is worse to be wounded by words than a sword.
Work and you will be strong; sit and you will smell.
He who flatters with laughter wants to see you cry.
If you don’t understand it with a wink, you certainly will with a blow.
Evening promises are like butter: morning comes, and it’s all melted.
Over truth there is light.
If there were no cold Friday evenings and boring Saturdays, no one would get married any more.
In every false step there is something good.
Compete, don’t envy.
A wise man without a book is like a workman with no tools.
A garden without a fence is like a dog without a tail.
A little nod is enough for the wise man; an ass needs a fist.
The falcon does not struggle when he is caught.
An old cat will never learn to dance.
Teaching in youth is like carving in stone.
A good name is more valuable than a velvet garment.
Among walnuts only the empty one speaks.
A fly will not get into a closed mouth.
If the judge is against you, you should withdraw the complaint.
An agreement is a kind of debt.
It is better to be the object of jealousy, than of pity.
Manage with bread and salted butter until God brings something to eat with it.
If you are a peg, endure the knocking; if you are a mallet, strike.
Either do as your neighbors do, or move away.
The tar of my country is better than the honey of others.
If a man leaves little children behind him, it is as if he did not die.
Strong attachment is difficult — it makes one mad or kills.
Friendship is honey — but don’t eat it all.
When my child and I have eaten — then clear the table.
If a rich man steals it is a mistake; if a poor man makes a mistake he has stolen.
Without fingers the hand would be a spoon.
Perform good deeds; you will not regret them.
Do not respond to a barking dog.
Lies have got no legs .
He who has nothing to die for has nothing to live for.
Instruct a woman, you instruct a nation.
The determined ostrich hunter will surely meet one.
He who follows the right path, thorns will not hurt him.
There is no queue at the gate of Patience.
Speech and action make the perfect conduct.
He, who takes from one to give to another, goes to heavens empty-handed.
Cautious people are safe.
Unless you put your hands in holes, snakes won’t bite you.
Instruct a man, you instruct an individual.
The liar cheats the greedy.
Love truth even if it harms you, and hate lies even if they serve you.
The enemy of my enemy is my friend.
The greedy man’s money is taken by the liar.
Work and you will be strong; sit and you will stink.
Instruction in youth is like engraving in stone.
Don’t cross the bridge till you come to it
Every beauty has got a defect.
No lamb has ever been born with its wool on.
Endurance pierces marble.
By all means make friends with the dog, but do not lay aside the stick.
No cat has ever fled from a house where a wedding party is held.
The camel doesn’t see his heap; he rather sees that of his friend.
A stone from the hand of a friend is an apple.
One who is not moved by words is not moved by the stick.
The hen lays an egg, and the cock feels the pain in his backside.
Kill two birds with the one stone.
He is accused of warmth whilst he is dying out of cold.
Abundance of money is a trial for a man.
No one knows my intentions except my daughter.
Do not correct with a strike that which can be taught with a kiss.
If you play with the dog, it will lick your lips
If the judge is against you, withdraw the complaint.
The heart of a fool is in his mouth; the mouth of a wise man is in his heart.
A known mistake is better than an unknown truth.
He, who thinks the soup is cold, he’s just to put his hand in.
If the step-mother were affectionate, the snake would be a healer
My close neighbor is better than my far brother .
He who wants honey should bear bees’ stings.
He, who has been invited in the day of the ceremony, has better to stay home.
Never pour your water until you get to water and taste it.
The shut mouth is not accessible to flies.
He, who is motherless, he is as if dead.
He, who ties it with his hands, must untie it with his teeth.
The hen washed its legs and forgot its dirty past.
The wall has fallen on its shadow.
A childless woman is like a tent without pillars.
The pumpkin gives birth and the fence has the trouble.
A wise woman has much to say and yet remains silent.
It is thanks to the holiness of the book that its cover is kissed.
The polite tongue can suck the lioness breast.
Believe what you see and lay aside what you hear.
Little by little, the camel goes into the couscous.
Whoever does not respect you, insults you.
Nobody has ever lived the way he wished.
Exert effort, you shall be rewarded.
He who gives fair words feeds you with an empty spoon.
If a man falls, all will tread on him.
An old cat will not learn how to dance.
One is carrying it; the other is suffering from its heaviness.
Don’t shoot till you get nearer and befriend someone till you try him.
You can’t catch two frogs with one hand.
He who chooses to be a grain, the hen will eat him.
No land without stones, no meat without bones.
He who bites you and you don’t bite him in return, you are toothless.
He, who has been bitten by a snake, fears the rope.
Many are the roads that do not lead to the heart.
Many hands make light work.
moroccan.description: The more help we have from others, the easier a big job becomes to complete.

moroccan.text: The chicken in agony, her eyes on food.
Nothing dries sooner than a tear.
Every beetle is a gazelle in the eyes of its mother.
Meat and mass never hindered man.
The woman is only but a woman. She’s neither a sun nor a moon.
